HomePage.title: Welcome to PetClan
HomePage.subtitle: Manage your pets' health, vaccine reminders, and more.

Hero.title: The care your pet deserves
Hero.subtitle: PetClan is the complete digital health record to track vaccines, weight, deworming, and more. All in one place.

vaccines.title: Vaccination Calendar
vaccines.description: Track applied vaccines and get alerts for upcoming due dates.

weight.title: Weight Control
weight.description: Historical charts to monitor your pet's weight evolution.

deworming.title: Deworming
deworming.description: Register and schedule internal and external deworming.

records.title: Health History
records.description: Save consultations, diagnoses, and treatments in the digital profile.

access.title: Universal Access
access.description: Access from any device, at any time.

security.title: Secure Data
security.description: Your pets' information is backed up and secure.

reminders.title: Smart Reminders
reminders.description: Never forget an important date again with our notifications.

CTA.title: Ready to take better care of your best friend?
CTA.subtitle: Join hundreds of responsible owners who already use PetClan.

Auth.loginSubtitle: Manage your pets' health, vaccine reminders, and more. All in one place.
Auth.acceptTermsPrefix: By continuing, you agree to our
Auth.termsContent1: These Terms and Conditions govern the use of the PetClan application (hereinafter, 'the Application'). By accessing and using the Application, the user (hereinafter, 'the User') agrees to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree with any of the terms, you must not use the Application.

Terms.section2Important: IMPORTANT: PETCLAN DOES NOT SUBSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL VETERINARY ADVICE.
Terms.section2Body: The Application is a management and information recording tool. Under no circumstances should the information provided by PetClan (including alerts, reminders, or date calculations) be considered as a diagnosis, treatment, or medical prescription.
Terms.consultationsBody: Always seek the advice of your qualified veterinarian regarding any questions about your pet's health.
Terms.emergenciesBody: If you think your pet has a medical emergency, contact your veterinarian immediately. Do not rely on the Application for life-or-death situations.
Terms.variabilityBody: Deworming and vaccination reminders are estimates based on general guidelines. Every animal is unique and may require different protocols based on their health status, breed, age, and environment.
Terms.section3Body: The User is solely responsible for the truthfulness, accuracy, and updating of the data entered into the Application.
Terms.healthDataBody: You are responsible for correctly recording vaccination dates, weights, and administered doses. Errors in data entry will result in incorrect reminders.
Terms.accountSecurityBody: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.
Terms.section4Body: To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, PetClan's developers and owners shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages, including but not limited to:
Terms.liability1: Damage to health or death of pets arising from the use or misuse of the Application's information.
Terms.liability2: Loss of data, service interruptions, or technical failures.
Terms.liability3: Costs of veterinary services incurred or not incurred based on the Application's reminders.
Terms.section5Body: All content, design, source code, and logos of PetClan are the exclusive intellectual property of its developers, unless otherwise indicated (such as open-source libraries). Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, or modification is prohibited.
Terms.section6Body: We respect your privacy. The data collected is used exclusively for the operation of the Application (management of pet profiles). We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties for advertising purposes.
Terms.section7Body: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Argentine Republic. Any dispute relating to these Terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires.

TermsPage.title: Terms and Conditions of Use
TermsPage.questions: If you have any questions about these terms, please contact us through our support channels.

Footer.termsPrefix: By browsing this site, you agree to our

Header.summary: Here's the summary of your pack today.

Pets.ageYears: {count, plural, =0 {0 years} one {1 year} other {# years}}
Pets.ageMonths: {count, plural, =0 {0 months} one {1 month} other {# months}}
Pets.ageDays: {count, plural, =0 {0 days} one {1 day} other {# days}}

Alerts.noAlerts: You don't have any pending alerts for your pets.
Alerts.weightMissingMessage: We don't have a record of {name}'s last weight check. Keep it updated.
Alerts.weightOverdueMessage: It's been {days} days since their last check. Because they are an {stage}, we recommend weighing them every {interval} days.
Alerts.weightUpcomingMessage: In {days} days it's time for {name}'s weight check.
Alerts.actionRequiredWeightDesc: Due for {label}, but we need an updated weight.

Tips: Keep vaccines up to date to prevent serious diseases.
Daily exercise is vital for your pet's mental health. A 30-minute walk makes a difference.
Wash food and water bowls daily to avoid bacteria.
Chocolate is toxic to dogs and cats. Avoid giving it even in small amounts.
Use an ID tag with your number, even if your pet is microchipped.
Brush your pet regularly to reduce shedding and maintain healthy skin.
Visit the vet at least once a year for a general checkup.
Keep your pet free of fleas and ticks year-round.
Fresh, clean water should always be available.
Avoid giving them cooked bones, as they can splinter and cause internal damage.
Obesity reduces your pet's life expectancy. Control their portions.
Socialize your puppy early with other dogs and people.
Check their paw pads after long walks or on rough terrain.
Never leave your pet locked in the car, especially on hot days.
Clean their teeth regularly to prevent periodontal diseases.
Observe changes in their behavior; it can be a sign of illness.
Keep cleaning products and medications out of their reach.
Provide interactive toys to stimulate their mind.
Human food with high fat or seasoning can cause pancreatitis.
Establish a feeding and walking routine to give them security.
Check their ears weekly for infections or dirt.
If you have a cat, keep their litter box clean daily.
Positive reinforcement training builds the bond and improves behavior.
Know the toxic plants for pets and avoid them in your home.
Trim their nails regularly to prevent pain and walking problems.
Mental exercise is just as important as physical; teach them new tricks.
Do not self-medicate your pet with human drugs.
Use a seatbelt or carrier when traveling by car.
Deworm internally every 3-6 months as indicated by your vet.
Xylitol (sweetener) is extremely toxic to dogs.
Brush your cat to prevent hairballs in their stomach.
Identify 'pet-friendly' places before taking a vacation.
Give them a quiet space of their own where they can rest undisturbed.
Heat stroke is a medical emergency; keep them cool in summer.
Spaying/neutering prevents health and behavioral issues, and helps population control.
Playing 'fetch' is excellent cardiovascular exercise.
If your dog eats very fast, use slow feeders.
Cats need scratching posts to mark territory and care for their claws.
Clean the discharge from their eyes gently with a damp gauze.
Protect your pet from fireworks; the noise causes them anxiety.
Keep the trash closed to prevent them from eating something inappropriate.
Reward good behavior immediately so they associate it.
Swimming is a great low-impact exercise for dogs with joint problems.
Avoid walking on hot asphalt; if it burns your hand, it burns their paws.
Cats may drink less water than they need; consider water fountains.
Check their coat after walks in the countryside looking for seeds or parasites.
Onions and garlic are toxic to dogs and cats.
Environmental enrichment prevents boredom and destruction at home.
Consult your vet about the best diet for your pet's age and breed.
Love and attention are as important as food and shelter.
